Analyze context management system where 200k token capacity has 85% compaction threshold at 170k tokens. User concerns: 1) When compaction triggers context loss occurs reducing accuracy from 99-100% to lower levels 2) Need visual analysis of how different input sizes (10k vs 50k vs 80k tokens) affect compaction timing 3) Proposal: Store full context externally (cache/DB) before compaction, reload when needed to maintain 100% accuracy 4) Alternative: Use /clear command to reset to 0 tokens, reload critical context from storage 5) Question: Which approach is world-class industry standard (Google/Amazon/Microsoft/Meta/Netflix)? Provide: A) Detailed mechanics of how compaction causes context loss B) Visual token flow diagrams for different input scenarios C) Comparison of cache vs DB vs hybrid storage approaches D) When to use clear+reload vs external storage E) Production-ready implementation with 100% accuracy guarantee F) Zero context loss strategy even at 95%+ token usage G) Automated context preservation with fail-fast validation. Requirements: Production-ready, zero breaking changes, comprehensive validation, benchmarked against industry leaders.

User's brilliant insight: Database-First Architecture for multi-instance context management. Requirements: 1) Project-based: Create project ID, store ALL context in DB 2) Multi-instance: Support 10+ parallel Claude Code instances accessing SAME project context 3) Crash-safe: If cache crashes, reload from DB with zero loss 4) Async loading: Load DB ‚Üí Cache asynchronously without blocking 5) Scale: Handle millions of tokens (1300+ story points) 6) 100% context availability across all instances 7) Clear+reload: Reset tokens to 0, reload from DB 8) Production-ready for concurrent development. Why DB-first wins: Cache volatile (crashes lose data), DB persistent (never loses data), Multiple instances need shared state, Large projects exceed cache capacity. Provide: A) Complete DB-first architecture (PostgreSQL primary, Redis secondary) B) Project management system (create/load/share projects) C) Multi-instance coordination (10+ instances, same project) D) Async cache warming strategy E) Context synchronization across instances F) Production implementation for 1300 story points G) Benchmark against GitHub Copilot, Cursor AI. Zero breaking changes, world-class standards.
